metadata.purpose: Design inspiration for Artibound card game
metadata.notes: This file contains card data from Artifact Foundry for design inspiration. Use this to understand card costs, effects, and design patterns.
metadata.extractionStatus: Partial - Some cards have full descriptions extracted, others have placeholder descriptions. To extract more: navigate to thinkArtifact.com, search for a card, click on it to view details, and copy the description text.

signatureCard.name: Culling Blade
signatureCard.description: Slay a damaged enemy unit with 3 or less ▥ and Stun other enemies for 1 action. Repeatable this round when you slay a hero

cards.name: Culling Blade
cards.description: Slay a damaged enemy unit with 3 or less ▥ and Stun other enemies for 1 action. Repeatable this round when you slay a hero
cards.designNotes: Conditional removal with repeatability - creates interesting decision points about when to use it

cards.name: Berserker's Call
cards.description: Active 2■, 1 Mana: Battle all adjacent enemies.
cards.designNotes: Hero ability that requires both cooldown (■) and mana - dual resource cost

costDistribution.1: Basic spells and creeps - simple effects, low stats
costDistribution.2: Standard spells and creeps - moderate effects, balanced stats
costDistribution.3: Mid-game cards - stronger effects, better stats
costDistribution.4: Premium cards - powerful effects, strong stats
costDistribution.6+: Ultimate cards - game-ending threats or effects

colorThemes.Blue: Control, card draw, AOE damage, manipulation, spells

cardTypes.Hero: Unique cards with signature abilities and active abilities

notes: Artifact Foundry uses a three-lane system with towers
Cards have attack, armor, and health stats
Heroes have signature cards and active abilities
Mana system with cooldowns (■) for active abilities
Many cards have conditional effects that create decision points
Cost curve ranges from 0-13, with most cards at 1-5 mana
Color identity is strong - each color has distinct playstyle
Tower enchantments provide persistent battlefield effects
Items are separate from spells and provide stat boosts
